Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pat F
Reviews.Content: Landed back in Belfast today after a wondeful stay at the Hotel Cecil and feel I must write a cooment due to our excellent experience staying there. Staff are very helpful, pleasant and have superb language skills, the Hotel itself is very comfortable and spotlessly clean. The little bar is well stocked and reasonably priced. My wife and I stayed in room 204 and although it is at the front of the hotel looking out over the street below, we heard very little noise and had no interuption to our sleep. The location is without dounbt one of Hotel Cecils strong points, 5 mins walk to the Spanish steps, 10 mins to Trevi fountain, 20 mins to the Coleseum and all sights worth seeing in Rome are within easy walking distance, including the Vatican which is around 40 mins walk at a slow pace. I booked Taxi service with Adele via email, and the drivers were both top notch and very reasonably priced. To sum up, I would highly reccommend this hotel to anyone wishing to go to Rome for a short break, its an excellent comepetitivly priced hotel well worth the money. ps, less than a minutes walk from the hotel (turn right on exit) is the T-Bone Steak station, an almost untouchable resteraunt serving some of the best food I had on our stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money in Rome”
Reviews.Author: magdalena94
Reviews.Content: After staying 5 days in a very expensive 5 star Hotel in Rome I had to find another hotel for one night before my departure. Walking around I came to Hotel Cecil. I liked my stay there better then in the 5 star hotel. It was cosy and secure. The staff was so friendly and made me feel good to be their guest. The location is the best, 1 minute from Spanish stairs, a few minutes from Fontana di Trevi and Villa Borghese. A lot of nice restaurants and little snack bars around the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, small though but that was the case also in the expensive hotel. I liked the breakfast aerea and enjoyed a good breakfast compared to many other places in Italy. Food in Italy is fantastic, they just do not care about breakfast so much. But it was really fine and I did not come to Rome for the breakfast. A taxi to the airport was organized by the nice staff and it arrived on time. I wish I could have stayed longer and will for sure come back to this hotel. I hope very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: KreyzTravelr
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel while walking in the neighborhood since we needed a room for our next 3 nights. We asked for a price and to see the rooms. Not all rooms are the same. Some are remodeled and are in better condition than others. I don't know if all in the 4th floor are the same-but the one we were shown was in real bad conditon. We were shown another in the second floor and it looked very modern. Finally we were given one on the third floor. It was average. The tub had mildew on the tiles, and it was very uncofortable standing in it since it was very narrow. Otherwise, the bathroom was OK. In general, it was an OK hotel in an excellent neighborhood. Breakfast ends too early-9:30 AM and one morning we arrived a little past 10 AM, but the girl at the bar graciously offered us coffee and a couple of croissants. We were very surprised by her generosity. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. We arranged for a taxi (car) back to the airport with them and it was ready even before the scheduled time (3:30 in the morning!). We were told there is a terrace on the 6th floor which opens after 4PM for drinks One night we went and it was dark and noone was there.

Reviews.Title: “Good till the last day”
Reviews.Author: Nada_K_R
Reviews.Content: Cecil is relatively good hotel, would say good value for money. Rooms have decent size, bathroom was clean, location is really good. Blanket on the bad was terrible: it was clean and good looking but it was made of of some cheap synthetic material that we were not able to sleep at all. Breakfast was below the average comparing to Germany for example, but not bad. If you want to have early breakfast (stated it is served from 7.00 am) it might be a disappointing experience if there are not many guests in the hotel (as in our case): they may be 30 min late without showing any shame or guilt for it. But, in summary all was reasonably good till the last day. You are expected to check out at 11.00. We woke up early and had a coffee outside. We returned to hotel at 9.00 to have a rest for an hour or two before our flight. To our unpleasant surprise they did everything to kick us out earlier: cleaning lady knocked our door every 20 min even though we told her we were sleeping. Then some aggressive lady from the reception desk kept calling room next to ours (cleaning lady of course left the door open) hoping we will be annoyed enough to finally leave. Then, since it did not deliver result they hoped for, receptionist called us and with obviously faked "kindness" asked when do we plan to check out (it was 10.00 o'clock after more than 40 min being of making special noise in the corridor, knocking at our door and calling rooms next to ours). Have to say I never experienced something like this in my life! When we finally left the room (it was of course before 11.00) receptionist (aggressive, falsely kind lady, probably the owner or oldest employee) had nuts to ask if all was OK during our stay. Actually, it was before she decided to perform her "kick the guests out" show. For us Cecil was somewhere between Average to Good, but due to very unpleasant experience we never had in our life before, we give lower score and advice to take other hotel: there are plenty of 3 stars hotels in the neighborhood, you can't be kicked out from all of them :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,rooms and excellent and friendly staff.Unforgetable "terrazo"”
Reviews.Author: alejandra g
Reviews.Content: Was my 4th time in Roma and the first at Cecil, I thinck excellent relation value/price, the atention of all staff is excellent, speciaally Valentino,seems Babel tower, speack in many lenguages...and smile every time. Definetely my hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keith P
Reviews.Content: We spent two days at this hotel. Our room was a good size with a decent bathroom. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The location was convenient to a lot of historic sites, and close to the railway station. They had a great roof top patio with a full serve bar, and breakfast was adequate but could be improved. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would return if we ever go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I like it”
Reviews.Author: 427jack
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Rome ( I traveled throughout italy). The location of the hotel was ideal. It' right off the main streets that have all high-end shopping stores: we walked to the major sights from the hotel. I had notified the hotel prior to arriving requesting they make a dinner reservation on my behalf. When I arrived all was taken care of as requested. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: jonathan m
Reviews.Content: it was my third stay at hotel Cecil and I enjoyed every minute there. rooms very quiet, very good location, all staff went out of their way to help us , even in the smallest way, especially adele, breakfast room a bit small. we will definetely return to a beautiful city and a smashing hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect, but hotel needs to be renovated soon”
Reviews.Author: ESCZ
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, but it is a shame the hotel is not taking more advantage of this. The rooms are incredible noisy and you can enjoy the snoring of your neighbours. Rooms as very old and not perfectly clean. It smells of damp and the bathroom could do with a good deep clean. Pleasant staff, but they don't really understand hospitality. Also, don't take breakfast. You are better off enjoying a cappucino and croissant somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing rooms. Dirty and smelly”
Reviews.Author: Davemichellel
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked promising on the net and it was in a great position but the rooms were very ordinary, broken shower and toilet, dirty and smelly. We both woke up the next day itching like crazy too. I would avoid this hotel, there are plenty of similarly price and located hotels in rome that are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: jrsdeck
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Cecil. We found the hotel to be clean with good sized rooms. The staff was friendly and helpfull. In particular, the staff came through for us when there was an unexpected taxi strike which left us no way to get to the airport. Through many phone calls, the staff were finally able to get us transportation that included a hotel guest who graciously helped. The staff went above and beyond in assisting us with this situation. Another good point of the hotel is its location. We could easily walk to most sites in Rome. It is also near the metro which we used without issue to get to the vatican. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Daisy Apartments - Not recommended, bad choice”
Reviews.Author: TruthMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: Our welcome gift (at the Cecil Hotel where you have to check in) was the order to pay the reservation in full up front in cash (Reservation was made and confirmed thru LateRooms.com, guaranteed with a Mastercard, it was NEVER told that we had to pay cash as soon as we arrived, so had to look for an ATM) Second, they ask for a 100 EUR deposit (Cash obviously) for the Apartment key .. Are you kidding? We are not backpackers , and this is not a hostel .. The Front Desk kept claiming, on a very clear, strict, and unflexible, but polite... Army Style Front Desk manner, that it was an error from LateRooms, not letting us know .. Buy guys, there is no value, even after the prepayment mandate, for an apartment in which the bathroom stinks like hell, spider webs hang from the ceiling, joined beds-to-make-a-kingsize have a canyon in the middle like the one in Colorado, and you´d better turn off the AC by 9pm, kind of accomodation. Expect zero frills, we had to ask for towels at the hotel cos we didnt even had that, forget the idea of an electronic key, its a 18th century lock that takes 20 minutes to open, and obviously no Wifi, ... well, you can use the PC at the hotel, one block away of course. The only perk is the location, its about 10 minutes walking to the Trevi Fountain, and 5 minutes to the Spanish Steps... BUT there are a million places to stay in Rome other than this .. We stayed there immediately after the Pope´s beatification, so the city was packed, so thought it was a nice choice .. Forget it .. I´d better walk and look for a hotel, than staying there again.. For the record, we had apartment 10, the others might be better.. but dont really wanna know...

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Papaluc
Reviews.Content: Ideally located a hundred meters or so from Villa Medici, the shopping streets, the Metro station and the bus stop (including Hop On and Off bus services). From there you can visit all the center of Rome on foot. The room have double windows that you do not hear any noise from the street. The room was spacious with king-size (180 x200 cm) bed, bathroom with bath, air conditioning but no refrigerator. The hotel has a lift but no restaurant. The hotel is clean and the lounge with bar is spacious. Free computer with Internet connection available in the lobby. Wi-Fi available in the lobby and in the rooms just above it! Don't forget to ask for the password at the reception desk. Breakfat includes sweet breads and buns such as brioches, croissants and pains au chocolat, hard-boiled eggs but not a large buffet as you can find in other countries. Personnel is helpful, specially a nice receptionist named Valentino. I would surely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a good simply hotel”
Reviews.Author: borkyhamtaro1
Reviews.Content: it is not a modern hotel but everything is clean and they were friendly en helpfull, the breakfast is simple but OK

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: derryj
Reviews.Content: I spent a great two days exploring central Rome from this friendly central hotel. Both the day staff and night staff at reception were very friendly and helpful, Giuseppe and Lidia especially. The breakfast was plentiful and there was plenty to choose from, though the coffee was stewed (as it seems with most Roman hotels). Though the hotel is central it is on a quiet side street, so there were no problems with late night noise. The Spanish Steps were about 3 minutes away and the city as a whole is a pleasure to walk around in, so much to see in a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: patpool
Reviews.Content: cant believe some of these reviews the hotel was fine in a fantastic location. yes its not a new hotel and when we walked across our room the wardrobe door would open but my sister and i found this funny and added to the charm of the place. the bathroom was small but rome is fabulous and we only wanted a quick shower and off out again. the staff where helpful and friendly and breakfast was fine some people are soooooo fussy

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: valbonne3
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cecil was the perfect hotel for our short break in Rome. We could easily walk to all the major sights - even the Coliseum was the furthest and that was only 20 minutes away. The staff on Reception were charming and we had a lovely quiet room at the back with a refurbished bathroom. The only niggle was breakfast which, as it was included in the room rate, I know we shouldn't moan about but, there wasn't nearly enough room to seat everyone and the food on offer wasn't the best. Drinks in the bar were expensive - a limoncello cost more than sitting opposite the Pantheon! On the positive side though the cappucinos were great and provided free of charge whilst you were waiting for a place at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: durgham_ali
Reviews.Content: From a worm welcome to a very pleasant farewell, Hotel Cecil was a wonderful experience and strongly recommended. The staff was more than helpful and understadning, we had what we need and more. We stayed in Daisy appartments with children and we have no complains, every thing we wished was met and done. Guiseppe, is one of the staff, and was extremly helpful when we wished to change appartment, ask for him at arrival, and you will get what you need, with a smile. Definitely going back. P.S. The location is supurb.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Best Familiar Hotel”
Reviews.Author: henrietteulla
Reviews.Content: My staying in Rome wouldn't been so amazing without Hotel Cecil special structure: a very precious hotel in the actual core of the eternal city; My boyfriend and I were surprised for such a warm and extremely kind attention everyone has payed to us. Of course: Rome is indescribable for its sightseeings and fascinating mysteries but I assure the Hotel gave a great contribute to my Roman vacation. Breakfast service was so defined, and the maid (Narcissa) has been incredible: her cappuccinos... so yummy!!! Concierge Staff has helped us in everything: good knowledge of the town and, all the time, extreme courtesy; well spoken English and such beautiful guys (Valentino, Simone)! I recommend this Hotel to all the tourists who want to feel typical Italian home warmth and kindness. Henriette

Reviews.Title: “Third time we booked hotel Cecil. Everytime we are very happy also this time again”
Reviews.Author: willy_buelinckx
Reviews.Content: Very charmant management . Lidia is realy a fantastic person who wants that all guests are happy in the hotel . Location is also great and people like Giuseppe are so guest minded that every request you may have is very well managed . The possibility to use a special taxi to go to the aerport and the very good prices ( same as a transfer by train ) ,hotel Cecil has negociated is very nice .

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic surprise in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jnorth85
Reviews.Content: After having an awfull experiance in the hotel elite next door (see my other review) i wondered into this hotel on the off chance they had a room and they did. we stayed one night in a reasonasble sized room, very clean and modern, and then upgraded for the small price of 10 euros to a massive room with a huge bathroom and great view. the cost was around 150 euros per night so well worth it, but what made the hotel so great for us, was the excellent staff who were helpfull at anytime day or night. very friendly place and great location, even though the building and the breakfast is a little outdated, that is easily forgotten about due to the relaxed and friendly enviroment........recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Traveller255365
Reviews.Content: For the price - this hotel was very dated. There was a distinct smell of 'dead rat' both outside and inside our room. The young men on reception were particulary helpful but some staff members seemed disorganised and flustered. The lift was archaic and slow and the breakfast room was very inadequate. Although they advertised that there was wifi access in the room it certainly didn't work in my room (4th floor) but I was able to use my computer in the lounge area near reception. This was one of the few places in my travels throughout Europe where I had to pay for internet access. However the hotel is in a good location - it's main selling point I expect.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cecil and Staff was a Wonderful Experience.”
Reviews.Author: 24trieste
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome from Venice without a Hotel reservation. A walk away from the train station in search of a hotel, we came upon several streets with hotels. We stopped at Hotel Cecil, sure that it would be way too expensive, talked to Lidia Romanelli (a young Sofia Loren look alike). She gave us a rate for our four night stay. We checked several other hotels in the same area, and nothing as appealing - aesthetically or price. Not only was Signora Romanelli very informative and helpful, her staff was outstanding. They were friendly and polite. Our special thanks to Valentino, Carlo and Ada. The location was perfect - near many of Rome's landmarks. Our stay was memorable, and we highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location and hospitally!”
Reviews.Author: maikki_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cecil has great location, warm hospitally, quiet to sleep ! We all enjoy staying there ( three woman - 18 - 45 - 72 years old ). we had accident in Rome and people from hotel helped us a lot !

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Willem1234
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was fine, especially the staff was very friendly and help full. The rooms are somewhat out of date but this is no problem if you shop the whole day in Rome. Breakfast is sober, but they serve a great cappuccino! Anyway the location of the hotel is in the middle of the center of Rome. The receptionist Giuseppe is a great receptionist and gave us good advice for taxi and trips.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've stayed in for a long time”
Reviews.Author: ianp1
Reviews.Content: When I read the other reviews of the Hotel Cecil on this site, I wonder whether the people who wrote them went to the same hotel. I found the place to be really pretty repulsive. In fact, about the only good things I could say about it are that the location is fantastic (just a couple of minutes by foot from the Spanish Steps) and the staff is friendly. Other than that, the rest of my experience was pretty abominable. First of all, I was shown to a room on the second floor (202, I think), which was really small, very rundown and extremely smelly. I can't remember the last time I asked to change rooms in a hotel... but in this case, I would have actually changed hotels if they hadn't had anything else to propose because the room really gave me the creeps. The guy on the front desk was really helpful and gave me the key to another room. The only problem was that when I finally managed to open the door, there was somebody else's suitcase already in there. He'd forgotten it had already been attributed. In the end, it was not so much a case of third time lucky, but third time "vaguely acceptable"... as I settled into a room on the fourth floor. Throughout all of this, I had expended numerous calories walking up and down the (rather dirty) stairs because the lift took forever to come. The couple of times I did manage to catch it, it jumped down about 50 centimetres every time I stepped into it—a little scary. What was even more frightening was all the hair that somebody else had left behind in my bathroom. There were hairs on the walls, the floor, the bidet and in the bathtub. Yuck! Before I headed out for dinner, I mentioned this to the guy on the reception and asked that they be cleaned away. The way he reacted made me think it wasn't going to be done... and I was correct. When I got back, all the hair was still there and the next day I had to fish it out of the tub before I could take a shower. Otherwise, the acoustics in the hotel were lousy. I could hear someone in the room on the other side of the corridor blowing their nose. The decor looked like it hadn't been touched since the 1950s and the whole place didn't look very clean. In reality, it definitely doesn't look anywhere near as good as the deceptive images on the hotel's website. There was no hot water in the sink in the bathroom and only a limited amount in the shower. There was no Internet connection in the room... and no space in the breakfast room. So, I didn't get to taste the continental breakfasts which other people raved about. Instead, I stepped out to a nearby café... and was particularly glad when I checked out of the hotel for good. I was only there for one night... but would definitely never go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but thats about it”
Reviews.Author: OrakeiDan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location being half way between the Spanish Steps and the famous fountain. Apart from that it was a major letdown. It was the most expensive hotel we stayed in on our Europe trip. The rooms looked like that had last been refurbed in the 70's. They would only turn the air conditioning on in your room when you complained about it and then they would turn it off again in the morning. The breakfasts were a shocker. No wifi internet, however they did have a terminal in reception you could use, but after being on there for 10 mins they would pretend that they had to use it in order to get you off, then they would not use it. The woman running the joint was a scary beast and it appeared all staff worked in a culture of fear. I would not recommend this to anyone and we will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sistina Suites(Daisy Aparts)Well placed, great value”
Reviews.Author: cdun
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights, and really enjoyed feeling 'part of Rome'. The chance to live like local was great fun. Only complaint is that there should be more than one towel each offerred for four nights, and the quality of kitchen utensils was rubbish(the forks bent when trying to eat with them). Simple is OK, but the quality was junk. Our Studio was small, but adequate...really a hotel room with a kitchenette in a cupboard. We will reccomend it to friends, and will use again the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cecil, Rome”
Reviews.Author: StephenWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a family holiday at the Hotel Cecil for the week of 13th.-20th. August, 2009. The hotel was centrally located, literally only a few minutes walk from the Spanish Steps. The location of the hotel meant we could reach all key sights by foot. Great views from the rooftop garden. On arrival at the hotel we were warmly greeted, shown to our rooms which were on the same floor and next to each. As we were a family group, the hotel arranged, without our asking, to have the rooms located next to each other for convenience and enjoyment. The hotel Manager and all staff were very friendly and always greeted us with a smile and asked after our welfare. The Manager asked us daily if we had any problems and if we wre satisfied with the standard of our accomodation, service and cleaning. On arrival we were given a map of Rome, shown where things were and given advice about making visits. Throughout our stay the manager and staff helped with locating places to see and where necessary ,transport arrangements.The hotel areas and en-suite bedrooms were always clean and comfortable and air conditioned. We have no hesitation in recommending the use of the Hotel Cecil for a sight seeing visit to Rome. Finally, Rome is a truly wonderful city where every corner you turn there is always something to see, enjoy and marvel at.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much”
Reviews.Author: Zoefke
Reviews.Content: It was the second time I stayed at hotel Cecil and also this year I have no complaints. The hotel was lovely. Our room was big enough for three people and I think they 'renovated' the bathroom because it was very modern and nice. The service in the hotel was great. The people were friendly, they asked how your day had been etc. and if I can say it... the men who work there are good looking ;) . Breakfast was good. There was enough variety in it. Even after 8 days I wasn't getting tired of eating all the things you could chose. So I can't say anything bad about my stay at hotel cecil beside the fact that my stay was too short. If I ever go back to Rome (I know I will), I will stay at hotel Cecil!!! Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bg19388
Reviews.Content: The front desk was excellent. They gave out maps of Rome which helped when getting around. The lobby was very bright and welcoming and nice to relax with a bar. There is an elevator which was helpful. The airconditioning was strong and cold, which was great because it was so hot out. The windows were sound proof, so we got a good night's sleep. The breakfast was good. The location was very close to the metro and Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. There was a safe in the room, which was great. Not much negatives, except the shower was very narrow and the water was sometimes cold when showering. The showerhead was placed in an awkward position making it hard to wash my hair. The room was also dark. There was no internet. The roof terrace would be nice at night to sit, but there was no light at all to see where you were walking on the roof, which made it scary and unsafe, so we didn't sit up there at all. Otherwise, the hotel was a nice stay while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended if you're looking for cleanliness! Location was great though.”
Reviews.Author: RCAVS
Reviews.Content: After staying for 3 nights at the Hotel Cecil in Rome, Italy, we could not wait to check out! The lobby area was clean and friendly. The rooms, however, we horrible! They had padded walls that were dark and worn, almost moldey. The bathroom had tiles falling off of the shower walls, the backsplash on the sink counter was coming apart, the blow dryer was broken, the TV did not work, the dresser had so much dust on it that when we placed the luggage piece on it, there was a dust-cloud that emerged! Disgusting! The hallway rugs were covered in dust and dirt as well. My nephews comforter had dry blood on it! Would never consider staying here again. The price was $160 euro per night which amounted to about $240 US dollars which was inexpensive considering the hotels location being very close to the Spanish Steps. I would have rather spent more money and had a clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: castor1Gent
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable hotel within walking distance of all cultural highlights. We booked a superior room and were located in a quiet (doubled windows, so no street noice at all) and spacy room. As we booked for 4 nights, we had a 10% reduction for 'long stay'. Breakfast was above what we expected for Italy (they don't have a breakfast culture) although we missed some fresh fruit. The friendly hotel staff helped us in French and English. Johan and Lutgarde from Belgium.

Reviews.Title: “Good memories”
Reviews.Author: ManJaAn
Reviews.Content: We've been to Rome the first time. This Hotel was recommended by our dutch travel agency. Big surprise........ Exactly what they said, a Hotel with class. Our stay in february 2009 with the meaning to visit Rome and have a central position in town. From the Cecil Hotel we walked to all nice spots in Rome. Trevi fountain ( max. 10 min. ) and Spanisch steps (really on 3 minutes walking) were really close to the Hotel. Further walking to the Colosseum, Vatican city, Foro Romana, the Pantheon, and other nice places was possible within 30 minutes to one our walking. Nearby we found some really nice restaurants, but around the trevi Fountain we found our place. Not to expensive but really nice and cosy was the 'Al Picchio' restaurant. Good food, nice atmosphere, and the staff is really Ok!! Further about the Hotel. After a day walking through Rome, the hotel lounge was a perfect place to evaluate the day. The Hotel staff was really friendly and always asking if you enjoyed the day. The rooms were Ok, and for a hotel build in the 16th century the rooms were clean, big, and the beds were ok. After a good night sleep the breakfast was good, More choice in food than an average person has at home. Croissant, toast, eggs, good espresso, and a normal choice of bread siege. Every morning before when walked out of the hotel, the nice reception lady asked if she could do something for us, or if we need some help to have a wonderfull day in Rome. My sumary, if you need a hotel from were you can visit all the nice sights of Rome, book this Hotel!! Regards An, Manouk and Jacq.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Mike7Riyadh
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Cecil Hotel over New Years. The location was excellent. A couple of minutes walk to both the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain! But still only 20 mins walk to the Colosseum. We stayed in single rooms. My room was ok, it was a little run down, so if you can avoid room 202 that would be best. My friend stayed in room 214 and that was updated and looked really good. Both rooms are small, but that is fine, it is just somewhere to lay your head for a few hours. The staff were helpful and friendly enough. I would say that the hotel enhanced our holiday to Rome, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: BangkokNegotiator
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel close to the spanish steps. We just arrived in Rome without any reservations and just walked around Both are very nice and clean. Small problem with the lights, but not a big deal. Breakfast is very very simple, so don't expect much. What we liked most is the location and the staffs. All in all, we recommend this hotel for mid-budget travel to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at The Cecil, in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Glowwormh92
Reviews.Content: Excellent service at The Cecil, in the heart of Rome. Date 1st to 5th September 2008 My wife and recently enjoyed a weeks holiday in the 'Enernal City' it was suggested to us to use the Hotel Cecil, because of it's central location, what a good choice it turned out to be. The service and staff were of high quality, the hotel was decorated in a traditional style, very smart decor and furnishings. The bedroom was a double room, with plenty of storage space, a desk, armchairs, again furnishings were high quality. A good size, on suite bathroom with an additional shower room. A full (help yourself) buffet breakfast was served in an elegant resturant, staff served hot drinks or other requests. The central location is ideal for the traveller who wants to visit the main attractions, Trevi Fountain or Spanish Steps are within a 15min walk, the Forum, Palantine Hill and Collosseum are within 25min walk, The Vatican is 40min wak, or all are accessable via The Rome Metro, nearest station 10mins. Would certainly stay there again, The entire cost for flights and accommodation (incl breakfast) was just over £500.00. The Hotel has an excellent website - www.hotelcecil.it

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: bob600
Reviews.Content: I loved the Cecil Hotel in Rome - the room was fantastic De Luxe Double, and the staff were very friendly and helpful especieally Sandy who cleaned our room,NY NY and I would certainly stay there again and again. I can't understand some of the bad reviews I have read on this hotel, all our experiances were positive, perhaps if you want to find fault you will regardless of the reality. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Cecil”
Reviews.Author: tx2888
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed at Hotel Cecil for 2 days in July 08 as our first stop prior to a cruise. We loved it!! It has to be the perfect location for both the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The staff was very friendly and accommodating especially helping us with our 12 pieces of luggage. The rooms were bigger than we expected and were very clean. The continental breakfast was also very good. The staff also did an excellent job in their recommendations of family owned restaurants in the area. In fact, this place was so good we elected to stay they our last night after our cruise. We will definitely stay at Hotel Cecil if we are ever back in Rome. We have already recommended Hotel Cecil to several of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: bahrain1979
Reviews.Content: The staff are really friendly and helpful with lot of good tips about places to visit and where to go to find good restaurants. Good air conditioned rooms and the safe in the room is always useful. Rooms and bathrooms nice and clean and good housekeeping service. Great coffee in the morning with breakfast also! This hotel is very well located (spanish steps, trevi, Pantheon) and with good access to the metro and buses which are easy to use in order to get around Rome. We think this hotel offers great value for money and intend to stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: mupquinn
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay in Hotel Cecil and I must say that I loved it. It is really tidy and clean and the staff were very helpful. The Spanish Steps are just around the corner. Another attraction very close is the Trevi Fountain. If I was ever going back to Rome I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, & service; you can do worse in Rome”
Reviews.Author: alamp23
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation through [--], a travel site that gives discount rates for reservations in less than 30 days. I studied Italian many years ago in Italy and have been to Rome many times. My tendency is to look for bargain basement places (around $100 or so). But as this was the last night traveling back from our vacation in Croatia, we targeted a $200 budget or so as we wanted to be closer in to the historical area and not deal with a super crummy room. Some things Americans need to be aware of about mid-range hotels (from my perspective, that's $US 150-$250 per night in the historical area) in Rome to give you context: - don't expect modern, remodeled rooms. Hotels commonly seem to have older furniture (1960's, 1970's). Cleanliness should be good. - you may want to make sure there is an elevator if you are a budget traveler with big baggage. - hot water with good pressure, and showers that have an overhead faucet are to be appreciated. Older hotel bathrooms frequently have just a small tub with a hose & shower head that goes a few feet high, so you have to sit in the tub to shower properly. The first thing that struck us upon arrival was the warm greeting and great service from the reception. Though I spoke Italian, the gentleman was eager to give an introduction to the neighborhood and offered in several languages. He pulled out a map, circled the hotel and then pointed out the sites near the hotel. We appreciated the warmth and pro-activity. The room was pretty much as described above. Room was very clean. Strong air conditioning with good controls. Furniture was dated. Bathroom had good overhead shower with warm water, strong pressure. Breakfast was included the next morning at 7am but we had to leave at that time so were not able to take part. Usually, breakfasts are fine though and include choices of coffee (Cappucinno, etc.) and tea along with croissants or whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Very good apartment”
Reviews.Author: Compositae
Reviews.Content: Belonging to Hotel Cecil are the Daisy Apartments, situated on a very short distance from the hotel in Via Zucchelli nr. 29. The apartments are of good quality, airconditioned and quiet. We spent a week in the apartment and became enthusiast about the location: just a few hundred meters from both Trevi Fountains and Spanish Steps, Via Veneto, and the metrostation on Piazza Barberini. The shops of Via del Tritone are around the corner. A perfect operating base to conquer Rome, for a reasonable price (the last aspect was not unimportant for us dutchmen). Marcel van Dijk, Almere, Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “loved hotel cecil”
Reviews.Author: KilkennyPaddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel cecil for one week june24-july1 and i had a fantastic time.The hotel is right in the centre of rome close to all the famous sites. it was very clean and the staff were friendly and welcoming. If i ever return to rome {hopefully i will} the hotel cecil is the place i will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Anothergoodtrip
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at this hotel and everything was great. The hotel is in a great location. The room was a good size and very comfortable. The staff were very helpful and looked after us well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Cecil!”
Reviews.Author: Nilanthi020
Reviews.Content: In an excellent location, we were fortunate to find accommodation in Hotel Cecil, which we had not booked beforehand. The hotel was bright and cheerful, and we were made most welcome by the friendly and helpful staff. Despite a couple of reviews to the contrary, our room and bathroom were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was basic but adequate. Plenty of cafes, bars and good restaurants in the vicinity. We would highly recommend it to other travellers and would have no hesitation in returning to Hotel Cecil! Nilanthi Kelsey

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Dara123
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the worst hotel in the world. I stayed here in May 2005. We were walk-ins, and the lobby looked nice. We asked to see the room before we took it, and they offered me and my mother a small room with no window. We said no, and to please show us another one. The only other one that was left was one for 200 euros, and since we were desperate, we took it. We had two suitcases and weren't about to waste a whole day in Rome looking for a place to sleep for the night. The room was the worst rip-off in the world. The bed was a large bed big enough for two, but the metal springs that the mattress was sitting on was sticking out and almost cut my leg as I walked by. That being said, when you slept in the bed, you'd inevitably roll into the middle because the springs in the mattress were so poor and the support from underneath was terrible. Then the bathroom had no mat to step on and no garbage pail was in the room, There were only two towels that they gave us, and one we had to share and the other we used to step on when we got out of the shower. But it gets better. There was no shower curtain or glass enclosure, so all the water from the shower ended up on the floor, we were slipping all over the place. There was a desk and a small TV stand that when opened, a bucket of dust like on the Munsters flew out. The phone was dead, and the light on the night table near the bed was falling apart, the bulb was about to fall out. We planned to stay in Rome two nights and checked out of this hotel first thing in the morning and booked another one near the bus station the next day for half the price and it was ten times nicer. I will look for the name of that hotel in my records and add it to my trip advisor profile, and then edit this listing and refer to it here. Please do not stay here. It's a terrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: NeilWyllie
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I arrived in Cecil a bit wary after reading some of the reviews in this site however we have to say we had a great time. Very helpful staff, bed in room was great and the room was perfect size (for us). bathroom was clean and kept clean, breakfast was good and location was superb. In response to some of the earlier emails we received three towels every day, air conditioning heating worked perfectly. checking out took all of 5 minutes and taxi booked for airport was early and very reasonably priced. one our first night we drank wine on the roof top garden (which again was clean-unlike previous review). Overall very much recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at hotel Cecil”
Reviews.Author: Brapim
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay in hotel Cecil. The service was good (for exemple: they carried our luggage). The people at the reception were very friendly. They helped us were we needed help and did so instantly and with a big smile. No trouble too much to make ourselves feel at home. The beds were good and we had a great shower. We even could watch dutch t.v.! The breakfirst was good as well. Not just coffee and tea, but also yoghurt, cereals, different kind of bread etc.. We recommend the hotel to everyone who is going to Rome! Patries, Stijn van den Broek (Holland)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but sad rooms”
Reviews.Author: Boro78
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night at Cecil in May 2006, the location is absolutely fantastic but my room was small, sadd and a bit smelly. Morover the entrance in my room was from the emergency stairs...

Reviews.Title: “perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: flossymop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Cecil with my daughter in September 2007. Whilst not the Plaza or the Ritz we found this hotel to be clean and comfortable for the price we paid. True it is in need of a little decorating but otherwise the staff were helpful and friendly, the breakfast buffet was adequate but most of all the location was second to none. We were litterally 3/4 mins walk from the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. We actually walked to all of the tourist sites from this hotel, the furthest being the Vatican City which was only about a 35/40 minute walk away along the river Tiber. We would not hesitate to stay at the cecil again. P.S. If in Rome then take the Angels and Demons tour, it is a fabulous tour.....

Reviews.Title: “nyce stay, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: yuppys
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in at Cecil was lovely, comfortable and quit. Every question and concern was answered with a smile. The staff handled our request by e-mail for tickets to Borghese Gallery , with no extra cost (meanwhile some website were charging me a lot..) Location is perfect, 3 minuts walking distance from Trevi fountain and spanish square. Would raccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Old Cecil”
Reviews.Author: Moment-of-truth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in Sept 2005 and I have been meaning to write this review for quite some time. I have noticed that others have written since and the reviews all have the same negative flavour. All I can add is to verify these impressions. Cecil is a very basic hotel. Our room was a disappointment. It looked nothing like the photographs pictured of the rooms, with quaint double beds. The bathroom was old and for 200+ euors a night they did not change the sheets once during our stay. I kept thinking that they might at about day 3 but "No" - no luxuries here. The breakfasts were very poor - packaged croissants, orange drink mix rather than fresh fruit juice. The only plus was the location - close to fabulous restaurants, walking distance to Trevi fountain - a vibrant part of town. I personally wouldn't recommend Hotel Cecil, nor would I stay here again. I would look for something around Trevi founatin area - as this is a wonderful part of Rome & clearly where all the good restaurants/ gelati bars are located.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would like to recommend this very central hotel, my husband and I stayed there from oct. 25/29, better than i expected. The hotel arranged pick up & drop off to the airport, very reasonable, staff very friendly, spoke English, and helped us with directions. Double room nicer than expected. Breakfast was okay, kept us going for a few hours. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to rome for business or pleasure, rooms are small, but sufficient enough, was actually expected room to be smaller then it was, was plesantly surprised on entering for the first time. Very close to tourist sights, about 2 blocks from spanish steps, and maybe 5 min. walk to trevi fountain. Metro 2 blocks away, very easy to use. plenty of shops and restaurant around, a very nice stay at this hotel, and hopefully will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Unspectacular”
Reviews.Author: ligea
Reviews.Content: While this small hotel is in a great location - just a few minutes walk to the Spanish Steps and the Fountain of Trevi - I would have to agree with the other reviewers on a few negative points. One reviewer states the hotel is in need of makeover which ironically one hotel booking website (not Tripadvisor) states Hotel Cecil was renovated only 2-3 years ago. My friends and I booked 2 rooms over 5 nights. Their bathroom was clean and newish however, the water from the showerhead flowed in a stream as if it was coming out of a tap. Also, the shower was over the bathtub (or combination of both) - this is not an issue as long as there is a showerscreen!! Consequently, the lack thereof resulted in a very wet floor. My bathroom was a HORROR. They seem to have missed the bathroom when renovating: old orange and brown 70s tiles (yes, original). Not dirty but how can you tell how clean it is when it's so old? Tiny, tiny shower (or should I say recess) with a nylon shower curtain. I wish I had taken a photo of the bathroom so you could see just how AVERAGE it was. To the hotel's credit, conversely to the other reviewer, we found both our rooms had individually controlled airconditioning which worked rather well. Another good point was the double set of windows completely blocking out the noise from the street below. We found the desk staff friendly enough, however when it was time to settle the account at checkout, the matriarch of this family-run hotel declined our traveller's cheques (in Euros mind you), which was rather inconvenient as we had to go to the nearest Thomas Cook outlet to get them cashed. The other problem we had was with the breakfast. All food was packaged except for a basket of bread rolls. Packaged croissants etc etc. But the worst part about breakfast were the dirty glasses which still had lipstick stains on them. At first I thought a customer had returned the dirty glass by mistake but alas, a few on the tray were the same. This tray of glasses had been placed on the buffet only minutes before by the waiter with water droplets still on some glasses, indicating they had just been washed. Apparently not well enough! Unclean. I would certainly NOT recommend this to any of my friends and would definitely not return myself.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers-esque”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed in the Hotel Cecil in March. While the price was reasonable and the location unbeatable, the hotel itself was a major letdown. Rooms are in major need of an update and breakfasts inedible. 'Highlight' of the holiday was a faulty fire alarm which beeped every 3 minutes from 6.00am. The night porter was utterly unhelpful and refused to replace the battery despite complaints from everyone on our floor. We will back to Rome but NOT to the Cecil

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Cecil
HotelInfo.Address: Via Francesco Crispi, 55, 00187 Rome, Italy
